strings.Value: "I killed Kargadd."
"Tell me about yourself."
"In that case, we'll talk later."
"I lured him into direct sunlight. He turned to stone."
"We cut his guts open."
"Tell me about yourself."
"Yes, there were troll younglings, Kargadd's children. They weren't dangerous. I let them go."
"Yes, there were troll younglings, Kargadd's children. I killed them as well."
[Lie] "No, nothing special."
"Tell me about your life in the Stolen Lands."
"Tell me about your wolf."
"What are your plans for the future?"
"You're not much of a talker, right?"
"I won't torture you with more conversation right now. We'll talk later."
"I'm sorry for your loss, Ekun. Tell me if there's anything I can help you with."
"I'm sorry that you lost your family. I would understand if you decided to leave me and get as far as possible from the Stolen Lands."
"Pull yourself together! I don't need any whiners in my company!"
"Where are you from? Where's your homeland?"
"Where did you learn to use a bow?"
"Do you worship Torag?"
"Do you have any family?"
"Tell me about Amanda and Clarissa."
"Let's change the subject."
"How did you end up in the Stolen Lands?"
"Have you lived in the Stolen Lands for long?"
"Do you like it in this country?"
"Tell me again about the trolls attacking your village."
"Let's talk about something else."
"Drive him away then, if you dislike him so much."
"You should accept his help. He's absolutely loyal to you."
"Aren't you going to give him a proper name?"
"I see. Let's talk about something else."
"I want you to leave."
"Leave my lands. Immediately."
"Excuse my rambling. Forget what I just said."
"I want you to leave."
"Take your things and leave my lands."
"Forget what I said."
"Remind me how you got him."
"Well, good to hear! Let's talk about something else."
"And what did you and Ntavi do when she took you from the party?"
"For what?"
"I understand, Ekun. You're welcome."
"Where have you been? And where is Ntavi?"
"Forgive me for not coming to the funeral. How did it go?"
"I hope you enjoyed the party."
"Have you settled on your plans for the future?"
{n}Ekundayo looks somewhere beyond you.{/n} "Forgive me, friend. My thoughts are on Kargadd right now."
{n}Ekun stands absorbed in his thoughts, which must be as heavy as the gaze of his dark eyes. Noticing you, he gives you a distracted nod and waits for your questions.{/n}
{n}Ekun turns his eyes on you.{/n} "Don't want to rake up the past. Not now, when the wound still bleeds. Must kill Kargadd and regain my peace."
{n}Ekun closes his eyes and sighs, relieved. His wrinkled brow smoothes somewhat.{/n} "You stole my vengeance. But it's no grudge to hold. You did the right thing."
{n}Ekun stares at you closely.{/n} "I want to know it all. Tell me how it happened. Tell me of his suffering."

{n}Ekun looks at you. For a long moment it seems like he'll smile, but he never does.{/n} "An eternity spent in stone. A decent end. By {g|Torag}Torag{/g}, your fame comes well earned. But it seems there was something else happening there."

{n}Ekun looks at you. For a long moment it seems like he'll smile, but he never does.{/n} "You freed the world of a terrible monster. By {g|Torag}Torag{/g}, your fame comes well earned. But it seems there was something else happening there."
{n}Ekun seems surprised, then angry, then contemplative.{/n} "Don't know if I have the courage inside to act that way," {n}he says quietly.{/n}
{n}For a moment, Ekun seems angry, but he brushes the emotion away.{/n} "You acted as you saw fit. Not going to pass judgment on you. The deed's done, and that's most important."
"Vengeance is done, but the pain remains. You're worthy of gratitude and loyalty. You'll get all the answers I promised. I owe you."
{n}Ekun winces, then nods.{/n} "You made the right choice. Youngling trolls just grow into full trolls. Better for everyone if they never grow at all."
{n}For a moment you can almost glimpse a smile in Ekun's eyes.{/n} "Someone has to be. To balance you."
{n}Ekun's eyes look at you, but his thoughts obviously wander somewhere else.{/n} "To protect you." {n}He shrugs.{/n} "Doesn't matter."
{n}Ekun nods gratefully.{/n} "Thank you. Talking with you already helps."
{n}Ekun frowns, looking into your eyes.{/n} "Would prefer to stay, if you don't want to drive me away. Nowhere else to go."
{n}For a moment, Ekun's eyes flash with defiance, but it disappears almost immediately.{/n} "Hard to do so. Forgive me."
{n}Ekun nods curtly.{/n}
"Why ask?" {n}Ekun winces and stays silent for a while.{/n} "Loved them," {n}he finally answers, turning away.{/n}

"No," {n}he answers indifferently.{/n} "Mother died early. Father died later." {n}He stays silent for a while, than resumes.{/n} "Wife Amanda and daughter Clarissa died recently. {g|Torag}Torag{/g} bless their souls."

"Yes," {n}Ekun nods.{/n} "All gods are even in the eyes of men back in the motherland. Chose the one that fit best, though he's a dwarf god." He shrugs and glances at his longbow. "Used to guard decent men and craft bows. {g|Torag}Torag{/g} blesses both guards and crafters."

"When wayfaring," {n}he answers.{/n} "Traveled through the northlands countless times. Guarded trade caravans. Those who paid with gold dealt with the merchants. Those who wanted to pay with steel dealt with me."

"{g|Thuvia}Thuvia{/g}, far south. A desert that treats the sun orchid like gold. Father took me to {g|Absalom}Absalom{/g} when I was thirteen. Never been to my homeland since. Roads always led north of Absalom." {n}He shrugs.{/n}
{n}Ekun shrugs indifferently.{/n}
"Happy pages of life. Good to recall. Hurts to come back."

"Got married," {n}he answers.{/n} "Crossed northern lands back and forth for a long time. Often came to the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}. Spent nights in Bristlehill. Recognized Amanda there, and she recognized me. One day, realized leaving wasn't desirable anymore."
"Too long — forgot how to defend. Too short — not enough to raise a daughter. Depends how you measure time."

"Yes, but the {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g} have no credit in that. Seen many places worth staying. Always passed by." {n}Ekun shrugs.{/n} "People by your side are more important than woods and hills around you. Found those people here."

{n}Ekun swallows a lump in his throat.{/n} "They attacked at night. Slaughtered everyone," {n}he answers.{/n} "We all knew about trolls. Never thought they would come to the village. Never believed..." {n}Ekun closes his eyes and shakes his head, as if in denial.{/n} "They came before dawn. Plundered houses. Killed dogs. Cows. People. They ate. Then gathered everything they could and left."

"Not mine," {n}he answers. Noticing this answer isn't satisfactory, he goes on.{/n} "Never wanted a pet. Never needed one. But couldn't slay the trolls, defend the village. Just called for help." {n}Ranger shifts his frowning gaze to the side.{/n} "Everything grew dark for a moment. Fainted. Came back with the tongue of this... dog... on my face."
{n}Ekun nods curtly.{/n}
{n}Ekun shrugs.{/n} "Probably will do it."
{n}Ekun frowns.{/n} "Never called for this dog. Guess he should be accepted? Just don't know."
{n}Ekun sighs.{/n} "Not mine," {n}he explains.{/n} "A name would make him mine."
{n}Ekun stares at your without saying anything. His face betrays no emotion, but he's clearly waiting for you to continue.{/n}

{n}Ekun takes a deep breath and nods.{/n}
"Farewell."
{n}Ekun watches you intently, waiting for you to continue.{/n}

{n}Ekun takes a deep breath and nods.{/n}
"Farewell."
"If you say so."
"As you say."
{n}Ekun looks at the wolf. His eyes become noticeably warmer, and a faint smile appears on his lips.{/n} "Okbo."
"Not my wolf." {n}Ekun sounds relieved.{/n} "His own. Now for sure."
[Looks attentively at Ekun]
"Rain, wind, storm — he keeps silent. And moves forward. Something to learn." {n}Ekun pauses, then meets your gaze.{/n} "All of you... were right to make me change my mind. Thank you."
{n}Ekun nods and looks at you expectantly.{/n}

"Never wanted a pet. Never needed one. But couldn't slay the trolls, defend the village. Just called for help." {n}Ranger shifts his gaze to the side.{/n} "Everything grew dark for a moment. Fainted. Came back with the tongue of this dog on my face."
"Now he is mine. And I'm his. Good that it turned out this way. Okbo is a loyal soul."
"I'm not keeping him. I'm not sending him away. He knows it and chooses to stay. Fine by me."
"Talked. Remembered the past. Don't tell me you thought..." {n}Ekun stops and turns bright red.{/n}
{n}Ekun stands and greets you with a faint smile.{/n} "{name}."
{n}Ekun greets you with a nod.{/n} "I... wanted to thank you."
{n}Ekun looks confused for a moment, fighting for the right words.{/n} "For... helping me find the way."
{n}Ekun sighs, relieved.{/n} "I am glad I met you. And I can be here. Here, I am of use."
{n}Ekun frowns, then turns away.{/n} "Went hunting. With Ntavi. Needed... fresh air. She left not long after — she had things to do."
{n}Ekun nods, wincing.{/n} "Not very. There were uninvited guests. But I'm glad I did it."
{n}Ekun's brows furrow anxiously. Finally he answers,{/n} "Yes. Nice to see old friends. And spend time with new ones."
"But... hmm... Next time, warn me. Especially if Elina will be there."
"Want to stay here. Protecting people is my destiny. I accept that now. The river of life carried me for a long time, powerless and still. Now I know how to swim."

{n}Ekun nods.{/n} "There is no place for monsters in the world. So I will hunt them. Hunting is my life. I was afraid to admit it for a long time. But fear, despair, doubt — all that is gone. All that is left is my resolve."
"Elina is also glad that I... {d|Ekun Ritual}made up my mind{/d}. Gave me armor. So that I'd 'be more careful'. I didn't expect it, but the armor is welcome."
"Decided this had to be marked somehow. Carved a new bow. I think it turned out well enough."
"You too worship the Father of Creation, don't you? Good. He's the best deity for a leader. Teaches to build, not destroy."
"Life story is open to you. You deserve it. Ask."
